Crimes.Crime_Name: Inadmissibility under the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Does the applicant meet the criteria for a stay of deportation pending judicial review?
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant entered Canada fraudulently, raising admissibility concerns. No new evidence supports irreparable harm beyond general deportation consequences.
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Challenge to inadmissibility based on fraudulent entry
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Tripartite test: serious issue, irreparable harm, balance of convenience
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Presence of irreparable harm beyond general consequences of deportation
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Application for stay pending judicial review
Crimes.Review_Standard: Tripartite test for granting a stay
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Not explicitly assessed, but lack of new evidence noted
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Prior risk assessments, spousal dependency claims
Crimes.Application_Basis: Judicial review of permanent residency denial
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Prevention of deportation during judicial review
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Serious issue, irreparable harm, balance of convenience
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of evidence showing irreparable harm
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: No irreparable harm demonstrated beyond typical deportation consequences
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicant sought to prevent deportation after being deemed inadmissible due to fraudulent entry
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Existing evidence found insufficient to support irreparable harm
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act - Admissibility provisions
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: No new or compelling evidence presented
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Evidence did not meet threshold for irreparable harm
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Failure to demonstrate irreparable harm required for stay
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of conclusive proof of spousal dependency and prior rejected risk assessments
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Tripartite test for stay of deportation

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Immigration inadmissibility and stay of deportation
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Can the applicant's deportation be stayed pending judicial review of his denied permanent residency application?
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Application for stay pending judicial review
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Spousal dependency not conclusively proven; prior risk assessments rejected
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence, personal claims of dependency
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Challenging denial of permanent residency due to fraudulent entry
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Lack of evidence for irreparable harm
Crimes.Proceeding_Type: Judicial review with request for interim relief
Crimes.Application_Error: Use of fraudulent document for entry
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Serious issue, irreparable harm, balance of convenience
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: Prior risk assessments deemed irrelevant or insufficient
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Eligibility for stay during review of permanent residency refusal
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act â€“ Admissibility and stay provisions
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Fraudulent entry and lack of irreparable harm
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Insufficient evidence to prove spousal dependency and irreparable harm
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Process followed standard judicial review procedures
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Uncorroborated claims of dependency and risk
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Request for stay based on ongoing judicial review
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Timing and conditions for stay of deportation
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to disclose or correct fraudulent entry
